text: Because most men don’t act right. You’ve just made yourself look like an utter dumb arse.
@wakanwolf bitch yall have way more than equality.. Smh
@lanasgunsandroses - said the woman
@daydreaming.24.7 you tell us to get over yourself, just like the meaning of this post got over you right?
Amen brother!
It's a damn ad telling guys to stop other guys from being dicks, get over yourself
They shouldn't be that angry about it chief
@mializmoore lets build a wall 😂
@mializmoore yup!! 👏👏👏👏

@masculineactivism exactly. I just think these conversations are so hard because I, as a woman, will never understand how advertising is seen through male eyes. And men will never be able to see it through female eyes. It’s a hard gap to bridge.
@young_lions_perspective that makes me very happy! 👏👏👏

@mializmoore I agree that men don’t have to be this tough stereotypical male and should stick up for each other. I guess what I enjoy about the ad is that it’s starting a conversation (at least with people that can have civilized conversations like us). As much as I agree that society shouldn’t pressure men to be masculine, they shouldn’t bash men to not be masculine either. Some people think masculinity is toxic or fragile or bad, but it’s not. There’s nothing wrong with being a feminine guy, there’s nothing wrong with being a masculine guy, there’s nothing wrong with going to the gym with your friends or wanting to put on makeup. Every man should decide for themselves what the definition of a man is. A company shouldn’t be trying to tell us that definition

@masculineactivism perhaps it was designed for women, I’m not sure. All I know is that for once it was nice to see men, good, respectful men of all ages and races, sticking up for the underdogs. I think there’s a very toxic idea in our country that men always have to be strong, tough, and angry. That ideal is ruining our societies ability to stick up for one another, especially young boys who are being bullied or abused who should just “man up” or “stop being such a pussy.” To have an ad show young boys that it’s okay to stick up for people who need help, and to expect and demand human decency towards ALL people was very refreshing but again, it could just be me.

@mializmoore I disagree, it is very empowering to have a good dad son relationship and it is nice to see a commercial where the dad teaches his son how to shave. Ads from these companies should be positive towards men and not scolding. Obviously you see this ad from a different perspective but you say that they are catering to one audience only. I don’t see anything wrong with that. Most of their customers are male so it makes sense to target that demographic. I don’t know who was the person in the marketing department that thought this ad was a good idea according to these facts, unless they were just going for outrage advertising.

@masculineactivism I don’t need to see a father and son experiencing shaving for the first time. I never really understand why that message was so cute, empowering, emotional, or whatever other emotion we’re supposed to get out of a father teaching his son something that girls have to learn by themselves all the time. There’s no romanticization of mom’s teaching their daughters how to shave their legs, arms, armpits, stomachs, or vaginas. An ad like that would cater to one audience only. Gillette tried to create an ad that inspired men to watch out for those around them and speak out against bullying, harassment, and sexism. That seems like a wonderful message to me. Only when we encourage those with power to address problems will we truly be able to stop it. I don’t think this advertisement was sexist at all, nor that it “demonized all men.” It simply introduced the idea that when harassment is noticed, it should be addressed, and that men should not be allowed to sit out of helping someone because “boys will boys.”

@ladybreepresents you’re just making assumptions than men are inherently this indestructible force and women are these fragile beings. Yes I agree that biologically men tend to be stronger than women, but that doesn’t change the fact that abuse is abuse. Don’t shame men because they can’t “fight back”, it’s a sexist stereotype that all men are stronger so a woman can’t hurt them.

@mializmoore I agree, there are many ads that women don’t like that say things like that. I agree that those ads are bad. Just because women get sexist ads, it means that you enjoy seeing sexist ads about men. How about we just dont have ads that criticize people based on gender, but rather individuals and their own actions. Ads should empower everyone and make people feel good about themselves! Wouldn’t it be nice to see a shaving company make a commercial about a dad teaching his son how to shave, or and ad with two dads or an ad with guys with different body types from different cultures. This would be much nicer than implying that men are toxic
As if we haven’t been hearing “some women act the right way” our entire lives. Get used to it folks, we sure have.
If the as were targeted at women Gillette would be history😂😂
Cuz y’all afraid of growth

If women were in positions of power for literally centuries in this country and constantly stepped on and belittled men and men were finally standing up for equality and the right to not be harassed on a daily then wouldn’t y’all support the ad? I still would.  Only men who want to keep women in the same place they’ve been for years are offended by this ad

Lol that’s not offensive... the ad wasn’t targeting all men.  It was saying that there are TOO MANY men who express toxic masculinity on a daily basis.  The ad isn’t telling men to be feminine or less masculine. Because masculinity in itself is not bad.  But when a strong percentage of men consistently harass or belittle women  the ad is saying hey step up and stop it.  It’s not saying ur the one who is doing these things. So if you got offended by the ad maybe you need to re-evaluate your treatment of women on the daily .

@the_anomaly08 Not shaving all the time is a behavior. Be more specific. I can’t just start calling up ads out of my ass. I don’t even watch TV all that much. I just see them on YouTube. I don’t know what their names are. And I am not gonna waste my time for you. Look them up yourself if you so pressed. 🤣
@eva__hi You didn't answer my question, I asked where are the ads that hold women accountable for bad behaviour? You just mentioned ads telling women to clean up.

@the_anomaly08 They’re everywhere. There was one with a razor company not too long ago that implied that unless your legs were smooth shaven, you couldn’t be seen by your partner. You had to be clean before you were to be seen by anyone. Imagine an ad where a man couldn’t present himself to his girlfriend if he didn’t have the smoothest face. Or if a ton of guys were being bitchy and one guy was just all perfect. Those are ALMOST ALL our ads. But wanna know a secret? Women don’t go batshit mad over an ad.
@ladybreepresents You'll have to excuse my spelling errors, I speak 4 languages, english is not my 1st 😆 how many languages do you speak apart from cow?
@the_anomaly08 😂 you’re the one that keeps getting punched! I don’t go near garbage people so Ill be fine. Have fun being illiterate.
@the_anomaly08 last message- for the love of satan- learn how to spell! How am I supposed to get offended when your sentences don’t even make sense?
@ladybreepresents My mom's a great woman, strongest lady I've ever known, not like you whiney bitter cows 😃
@ladybreepresents You need help. You're definately the type of person to twist people's words to make a point when you have no arguement 😆

@ladybreepresents What verbal assault? What harassment? Why are you putting words in my mouth 😆😆 I said I spout my mouth off with UNPOPULAR OPINIONS, do you not understand english? Say, even if I did "verbally assault" someone, does that give them a right to put hands on me? 🤔

@the_anomaly08 go see a therapist. You clearly have issues with women which probably stems from your relationship with your mother. Im off to work and wont be responding to your childish messages further. Have a lovely day!
@ladybreepresents "Men are violent"...guess that includes all the men in your family as well as any male friends you have too, right? Never knew my gender was inherently violent lol
@the_anomaly08 there we go. So you verbally assault and harass people and then wonder why they get mad? 😂 Grow up. What a miserable existence.

@ladybreepresents Yes I never put my hands on any female in my entire life, doesn't matter if you believe that or not. I spout my mouth off with unpopular opinions every now and then, which has taught me that alot of women cannot take criticism, hence why some feel comfortable putting their hands on others simply because they can't control their emotions.

@the_anomaly08 if you have been physically assaulted by women five times (im assuming you are claiming you didnt hit them at all? 🙄) if I was you I would really start questioning how I am acting towards women that makes them want to kick the shit out of me.
@the_anomaly08 riiight. Im sure it is a major problem. 🙄😂

@the_anomaly08 comparing female on female violence to male on female is like comparing an ant to an elephant. You want to pretend females are as violent as men? How many female mass murderers have we had compared to men? How many serial killers? That’s the tip of the iceberg. Men are violent. It needs to change. Now.
@katie_180_ Yeah, I'm sad bc I don't get to see my dog until monday, but will be going out for drinks later with the crew so that'll cheer me up 😃 hope you're gonna have fun this weekend too 🖒
@the_anomaly08 god you’re sad 😂
@katie_180_ It's a fact that you'd be offended, I can already see the feminazi protests on the horizon. Women tend to take criticism far worse than men do 😃

@ladybreepresents You also have no idea about hoe often men get assaulted by women at pubs, clubs, relationships etc, but never report it due to the shame attached. I've been physically assaulted by women 5 times and never hit them back.
@ladybreepresents You are ignorant and biased af, do you know anything about domestic violence amongst lesbian couples? Check how bad that shit is before you act like men are the only aggressors lmao
@the_anomaly08 bring them on 😂
@eva__hi BUT where are the ads calling women out for their bad behaviour? 🤔
@the_anomaly08 if they posted an ad saying women should be good to each other, you seriously think we’d be offended? 😂😂
@katie_180_ I can't wait for their toxic femininity ad 😆
@katie_180_ You know for a fact that if this ad targetted women, there would be mass outrage and screams of sexism, get off your high horse lady.
If there was an ad calling out the wrong things women did like slut shaming I would be very happy on the contrary so

@masculineactivism Someone voicing their opinion against you is attacking you? Grow up dude. Plus that ad wasn’t even offensive. There are ads out there that shame women for having body hair, having extra weight, not being hot, bashing our intellect, etc. Yet ONE ad shows up and you all get your panties in a twist.
@masculineactivism literally 👏🏼no one 👏🏼 is 👏🏼 attacking 👏🏼 you.

@katie_180_ everyone I debate with says that if I don’t agree with them, I’m part of the problem. That just toxic thinking and I’m tired of that mentality. I’m not part of any problem, I am a good person, I just think society needs to stop attacking men for existing.

If you can’t understand the message then you’re the problem 🤦🏼‍♀️ Its an ad saying be a good role model for your son and stand up against abuse and say something when you see something shitty happen. Yeah let’s boycott the shit outta that. Very cool and normal response.
@ladybreepresents I would try and get out more but I keep my wife locked in the basement and I just don't want to take the chance that she escapes. Enjoy your swim 😘
@thegrokelives wow! you really need to get out more! Im off for a swim! ciao 👏🏻
@ladybreepresents shed tears for you? Why would I do that when you are proving the point so brilliantly. This is the most fun I've had in the last 12 hours so please continue.
@masculinism101 😂😂😂 submerged
@thegrokelives cry me a river
@masculinism101 there's always one and she proves the point quite perfectly.

@thegrokelives 👁 I have experienced similar abuse at the hands of females, you are not alone.  Interesting to note that just for talking about this you have been attacked in replies by a woman who is displaying all the signs of a misandrist submerged in the self righteous ignorance of toxic femininity.  Hate is hate, and all sexes and sexualities are vulnerable to this hurtful condition of denial and violent resistance to truth and love.
@karmagonnagecha thanks ‘pisser’ 😂
@thegrokelives how could it be a threat? Are you implying men do something bad? im confused 😂
@ladybreepresents you should have called gillette for backup
I made a priv but like an extreme priv
It’s me
Erik
yeah, that ad was wild.

@ladybreepresents how exactly have I acted like trash? And how exactly have I intimated that I hate women? The video I referred to is just an opposite reaction to the Gillette ad which is to be expected and points out womens flaws, of which there are many, that doesn't mean I hate women 😂 you're here trolling in @masculineactivism comments and calling me a woman hater, come on now. I should hope you don't take what as far as men do? That sounds remarkably like a threat.
@thegrokelives and you should hope we dont start taking it as far as men do. Because just imagine if we did...
@thegrokelives ok and now you hate women? But women that have been abused by men (all women) arent allowed to hate men? If anything, you should see where we are coming from.

@ladybreepresents so because you're a female and I'm a male my experiences of domestic abuse and violence committed upon me by two women are invalid? And you're telling me to grow up? I didn't fight back because had I done so, I could have seriously hurt her, oh, and because I was unconscious and with broken and cracked ribs as well.

@thegrokelives oh sorry I just realised I should have told you the end of that story. Yeah my ex beat the shit out of me. But I eventually managed to kick him out of our apartment, told everyone what he did, and he got kicked out of his bands and had to move cities. You guys wanna act like trash- it will catch up to you. We are watching, and waiting. Have a great day! 🖤
@thegrokelives now im off to find this video you speak of so I can report the shit out of it 💕
@thegrokelives btw- hating women wont make them want to hurt you less. Just a thought.
@thegrokelives well consider yourself one of a very small percentage of men if that is the case.

@thegrokelives oh really? whats the average height and weight of a man compared to the average height and weight of a woman? ridiculous. I learnt not to fight back with my ex pretty fast because he could literally kill me. Grow up.
@ladybreepresents and having been on the receiving end of domestic violence and abuse committed by women I don't find it much of a laughing matter.
@ladybreepresents domestic abuse goes both ways.
@thegrokelives right. Because women are beating themselves up? 😂
v v true but also not all feminists would do that, there are toxic ones and peaceful ones. feminists are painted incorrectly and so is masculinity
The Domestic violence awareness Australia association has made a rather great video that has been released in the last 12 hours or so about toxic femininity.
I became a DSC member last night. #votewithyourwallet
